items.title: Bondi gunmen filmed 'firearms training' and threw IEDs into crowd, court told
items.description: The Bondi gunman accused of killing 15 people conducted "firearms training" in a regional area with his father and recorded a video about their "justification" for the attack, according to documents released by a Sydney court.

items.title: PM apologises in wake of Bondi attack, announces reforms
items.description: Anthony Albanese says he is "sorry" for what Jewish Australians have experienced, while announcing a package of legislative changes.

items.title: History tells us Albanese will call a royal commission into Bondi attack
items.description: The prime minister is undoubtedly facing tough conversations behind closed doors, but until the public gets to witness the scrutiny he will never satisfy his critics.

items.title: Doctors turn Ozempic patients away from surgery due to extra risks
items.description: Doctors say they are forced to delay some procedures due to the risk of serious consequences for patients on Ozempic-like drugs.

items.title: Measles cases triple in Australia as global outbreaks continue
items.description: The number of measles cases nationwide is now approaching triple the number of cases reported in 2024 as outbreaks continue around the world.

items.title: Japan prepares to restart world's biggest nuclear plant, 15 years after Fukushima
items.description: Japan has taken the final step to allow the world's largest nuclear power plant to resume operations with a regional vote in Niigata prefecture.

items.title: US attorney-general faces contempt push over Epstein files
items.description: Two congressmen say they will recommend United States Attorney-General Pam Bondi be held in contempt of Congress for not releasing all of the Epstein files by the legal deadline.

items.title: City Beach fined $14m over 'pervasive' button battery safety failures
items.description: The Federal Court orders the fashion retailer to pay $14 million in fines after it was taken to court by the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission.

items.title: Jessica was raped by her husband. It took six years to finally secure a conviction
items.description: Jessica Seage fought for six years for the man who raped her to be convicted. Experts say her experience is a stark example of how perpetrators abuse the system to inflict more pain on their victims.

items.title: Insolvent firm run by ex-AFL star wipes millions in debt via 'legal phoenixing'
items.description: A digital marketing agency run by a former AFL star has wiped its millions in debt through an insolvency process, only to open under a new ABN days later. Former staff were left without a job and almost $450,000 in unpaid entitlements, but it's within the bounds of the law and leaves taxpayers footing the bill.

items.title: Government announces domestic gas reservation scheme in bid to lower costs
items.description: Chris Bowen makes a long-anticipated announcement about reserving a portion of gas on the east coast for domestic use after a cabinet meeting.

items.title: High schools demand students prove they are not AI cheats
items.description: Pulled out of class, held back after school and forced to prove they're not AI cheats, students say NSW high schools are pitting them against faulty AI detectors.

items.title: Queensland man arrested following dozens of antisemitic graffiti offences
items.description: A Coolum Beach man is charged with 25 counts of wilful damage following a spate of antisemitic graffiti incidents.

items.title: Greyhound trainer banned after investigator finds messages to 'Anabolic Jim'
items.description: Victorian trainer Gerry Orr has received a six-year ban for procuring performance-enhancing drugs after he inadvertently alerted stewards by giving authorities his mobile phone.

items.title: Prince William and son George volunteer at homelessness charity
items.description: From America, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex have also sent out their Christmas wishes on Instagram.

items.title: Is buying vinyl records bad for the environment?
items.description: Artists like Stella Donnelly are searching for ways to cut waste and make production of their albums environmentally friendly.

items.title: Bazball finally admits its failings, albeit far too late
items.description: Losing an Ashes Test series in Australia is nothing new for England, but finally the Bazballers are looking inwards after a stirring end to the Adelaide Test.

items.title: Children and staff abducted from Nigerian school released
items.description: No group has claimed responsibility for the November 21 abduction of more than 300 children and staff from a Nigerian Catholic school.

items.title: Man accused of planning racial hatred event at Cronulla refused bail
items.description: A 20-year-old who allegedly tried to organise a racial hatred event at Cronulla on the same day as the Bondi Beach terrorist attack is refused bail.

items.title: A triumphant election year for Labor ends on less stable ground for both parties
items.description: The ABC's political reporters, commentators and broadcasters reflect on what defined the year in politics.

items.title: Between AI and humanoid robots, we could be at a turning point in history
items.description: What makes the AI-driven stock market bubble unique in history is that if it's not a bubble, the impact on humanity could be far more challenging than any previous technology.

items.title: Festive season to bring Perth heatwave, Indian Ocean cyclone
items.description: Perth is expected to hit a high of 41 degrees on Christmas Day with the Cocos (Keeling) Islands bracing for a tropical cyclone that could intensify to a category two system.

items.title: University accused of 'false advertising' after cuts disrupt degrees
items.description: A University of Wollongong student says she left the institution after being unable to complete core subjects due to course cuts.

items.title: The Wire actor James Ransone dies at age 46
items.description: James Ransone, an actor best known for playing Ziggy Sobotka in The Wire and also starring in It: Chapter Two, has died, according to LA medical authorities.

items.title: 'Another level of betrayal': Survivors search the Epstein files to find nothing
items.description: Despite giving an FBI interview and victim statement, Epstein survivor Jess Michaels finds no trace of her evidence in the vast trove published online.
